definitions.definition: the act of separating people or things; the state of being separate
definitions.sensetop: separation from somebody/somethingseparation between A and B

examples.text: the state’s eventual separation from the federation
the need for a clear separation between Church and State
the clear separation of powers between the executive and the legislature
the separation of children from their parents during the war

definitions.definition: a period of time that people spend apart from each other

examples.text: They were reunited after a separation of more than 20 years.
Prolonged separations of this kind are damaging to very young children.
She is visiting her family after a long separation.

definitions.definition: a decision that a husband and wife make to live apart while they are still legally married

examples.text: The couple are having a trial separation.
Sixty per cent of all marital separations occur before the tenth year of marriage.
She would not consider separation or divorce.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin separatio(n-), from separare ‘disjoin, divide’, from se- ‘apart’ + parare ‘prepare’.
